example.text: Since 1978, the Supreme Court had consistently held that race-based admission policies in colleges and universities are in the best interest of educational institutions, but this recent radical decision will dismantle efforts to ensure higher education is accessible to all students, further questioning the legitimacy of this politicized Supreme Court, which seems more eager to protect legacy admissions than providing students who are historically disadvantaged with equal opportunity to a quality education. Diversity makes our Nation stronger, and the repercussions of this decision will be felt for generations.

The House Gun Violence Prevention Task Force has been pushing for action by signing discharge petitions for the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, the Assault Weapons Ban, and to block the Charleston loophole. This is a bipartisan issue that a majority of Americans support, but we need support from across the aisle.

My staff has been hard at work, and I'm excited to announce that my office has recovered over $135,000 owed to constituents in NC-04 from federal agencies so far this year! As always, my offices in Washington, DC and in Durham are open for your inquiries and constituent service needs.

RSVP to the Gun Violence Prevention Community Discussion *Due to limited seating, registration is required. During the event, we would like to answer your questions regarding gun violence prevention, and you will have an opportunity to submit your questions in advance upon your RSVP .

The House Gun Violence Prevention Task Force has been pushing for action by signing discharge petitions for the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, the Assault Weapons Ban, and to block the Charleston loophole. This is a bipartisan issue that a majority of Americans support, but we need support from across the aisle.
